subject: Learning
title: Illusion of Explanatory Depth
description: A quick win: understand Illusion of Explanatory Depth.

hook.text: You know how a zipper works. Explain it. Step by step. Right now. Harder than you thought?

buildup.text: People believe they understand everyday things deeply until asked to actually explain the mechanism.

discovery.text: This is the illusion of explanatory depth: we confuse familiarity with understanding.

twist.text: It applies to everythingâ€”politics, technology, science. Confidence in your understanding often exceeds the reality.

climax.text: The fix is simple: try to explain it. The attempt reveals exactly where your knowledge breaks down.

punchline.text: You think you understand until you try to explain. Then you learn.

quiz.question: What is the illusion of explanatory depth?
options: Believing you understand something deeply when you only have surface familiarity
Understanding everything perfectly but being unable to communicate it
A bias that only affects scientists
